title: Switching $$x$$ and $$y$$
text: We must now substitute all instances for $$x$$ by $$y$$ and instances of $$y$$ by $$x$$. $$x=3-\sqrt[3]{y}$$
speech: We must now substitute all instances for  x  by  y  and instances of  y  by  x .  x is equal to, 3 minus the cube root of y

title: Solving for $$y$$
text: Now, we must manipulate the equation and solve for $$y$$. $$y={\left(-x-3\right)}^3$$
speech: Now, we must manipulate the equation and solve for  y .  y, is equal to parentheses, negative x minus 3,  cubed
